titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Brian Carpenter

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T21:15-0400

did.unittitle: A Survey of the Beaver Dialects With Respect to Tone Marking
did.physdesc: 5 compact discs (1 hr., 15 min.) : digital, mono.
did.abstract: Recordings of 5 speakers of Tsattine (Beaver) reading a word list to test for tone and dialect differences. Recorded in Doig River and Blueberry River, British Columbia, in July 2002.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Material
relatedmaterial.p: Accomapnying mansucript material (report on research, two sets of word lists used in elicitations, and related disseratation) can be found in the Phillips Fund Collection (Mss.497.3.Am4).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Julia Colleen Miller in 2003. This material was recorded with the assistance of a Phillips Fund grant.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: The recordings were accessioned into the library on 5 CD-R discs. When the collection was migrated into .WAV files in April of 2012, the first of the 5 discs was found to be in a corrupted state and the data unrecoverable. This disc contained a recording of speaker William Attachie, recorded in Rose Prairie (B.C.) on July 10, 2002, reading from an elicited word list for tone.
